section.title: Create and apply patches
section.para: The following example creates a branch, changes several files and creates a commit recording these changes.
The next example creates a patch for these changes.
To apply this patch to your master branch in a different clone of the repository, switch to it and use the git apply command.
Afterwards you can commit the changes introduced by the patches and delete the patch file.

tip.para: Use the git am command to apply and commit the changes in a single step. To apply and commit all patch files in the directory use, for example, the git am *.patch command. You specify the order in which the patches are applied by specifying them on the command line.
